title: Angular acceleration of bar as it falls

content.question: Which of the following graphs best represents the bar‚Äôs angular acceleration ùú∂ as a function of angle ùúΩ ?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice A is a horizontal line.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice B is a line that starts at the origin and increases linearly.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice C is a line that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin and decreases linearly, ending on the horizontal axis.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice D is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave up.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with alpha on the vertical axis and theta on the horizontal axis. Choice D is a curve that starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
